keywords: The Bon Appétit Fast Easy Fresh Cookbook
name: Cook the Book: Sesame Wonton Triangles with Smoked Salmon and Wasabi
description: Photograph from avlxyz on Flickr There was a time when crisp wonton chips with smoked salmon and wasabi would have been a very avant-garde thing to serve at a cocktail party. These days, they're almost retro. No matter: Everybody...
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup plus 1/2 teaspoon Asian sesame oil
Daikon radish sprouts or other small sprouts

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Whisk 1/4 cup oil and egg white in small bowl to blend. Place wonton wrappers in single layer on work surface; brush with some of oil mixture and sprinkle with half of sesame seeds. Fold diagonally in half. Brush with more oil mixture; sprinle with remaining seeds. Cut each into 2 triangles. Place on baking sheet. Bake until golden, about 13 minutes. Cool.

Whisk vinegar, chives, wasabi, ginger, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon oil in bowl. Cover each wonton with 1 salmon slice, then drizzle with wasabi mixture. Top salmon with sprouts, then fold salmon over sprouts. Top with more sprouts.
